alert.note: Alert for Barton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Barton County through 630 PM CDT... At 559 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Olmitz, or 7 miles northwest of Hoisington, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hoisington, Albert, Olmitz, Galatia and Susank. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
